On the sidewalk, a young boy named BILLY pokes at a DEAD with a stick, then picks it up and chases a group of screaming girls with it. No worries. Happy Halloween. Lori smiles politely, then turns and walks off. She grima and lets out a relieved sigh. Steven watches her leave. Intensely. Jimmy nods excitedly, chocolate icing smeared on his face DORA (cont'd) But do you know why you get dressed up? Or why you go door to door begging for candy? They shake their heads. Dora opens her thick book. OLD ENGRAVINGS and illustrations cover the yellowed pages. DORA (cont’d) Of course you don’t. Most people don’t know that Halloween goes back thousands of years. Celtic God of the Dead. {NOTE: Dora pronounces Samhain correctly, which is technically SAW-wane] The kids lean over the counter, staring at an illustratio an EIGHT FOOT TALL HORNED DEMON standing in a pumpkin pat It's a classic image, if somewhat cliche.

It's just a drawing. Samhain is always in costume, so no one really knows what he looks like. Could be anywhere. Or anyone.
(whispers to Brandon) I thought it was SAM-hain.

Suit yourself. But tonight is HIS night. And like any god, he has his rituals, and his disciples. (flips pages in the book) Demons. Monsters. Second, since the dead are pretty sure to go for a stroll, it’s a good idea to stay out of the cemetery. Break that rule and Sam-- (corrects herself) Samhain~~ is likely to turn you into one of them. Exactly. So if I were you, I‘d get your butts home before sunset and don‘t come back out until you’re dressed for the occasion. Todd turns and looks outside. It's getting dark. DORA (cont'd) (teasing) Tick tock, tick tock, tick tock.

Well people once tried to find a way to appease the appetites of Samhain and his horde, so they left crops and baked goods out on their doorsteps. Like a sacrifice. Over time, it became expected-~ and those who didn’t, paid dearly.

You're smarter than you look, kid. His smile fades. He’s about to take another bite of his cupcake when Dora snatches it from his hand. DORA (cont‘d) (looks at the cupcake) One more. Okay, okay. We break a stupid rule we get on Sam’s shit list and he sends some ghoulish hit man after us. Fine. But what if you're like some Halloween Scrooge who breaks all of his rules? He’s barely run a half block but is already wheezing. He stops to catch his breath, and looks around. It’s quiet. Sam is nowhere to be seen. Suddenly, he hears tormentor’s unmistakable GIGGLE. STEVEN (cont‘d) Well now...how about that?  3/21/03 TRICK OR TREAT Michael Dougherty 22. THE BOY COUGHS AGAIN and a wet mix of BLADES, NAILS, AND SHARDS OF GLASS, fall from his bleeding mouth. He claws a Steven, begging for help. Steven just coldly stares at hi STEVEN (cont'd) Trick or treat. Charlie gags once more, and slumps to the ground-- dead.
